item.title: Easier strace of scripts with pidof -x
item.description: Here’s a one minute read, about a trick which I discovered today: When running an strace, it’s common to do something like: strace -p<pid> Smarter hackers know that they can use some bash magic and do: strace -p`pidof <process name>` However, if you’re tracing a script named foo.py, this won’t work because the real process is the script’s interpreter, and pidof python, might return other unrelated python scripts. strace -p`pidof foo.
